grant.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for
grant.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
The council have granted him permission to build on the site.
A licence to sell alcohol was granted to the club.
Grant that we may know your presence and love.
grant.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually say give permission rather than grant permission:
They gave him permission to stay.
grant.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to admit that something is true although it does not make much difference to your opinion
grant.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He’s got talent, I grant you, but he doesn’t work hard enough.
grant.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an amount of money given to someone, especially by the government, for a particular purpose
grant.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The university gets a government grant.
Anyone wishing to apply for a grant should write to the Treasurer.
These studios are funded by a grant from the Kress Foundation.
grant.translation[1].note_box[0].section: The school has won a £240,000 government grant to improve its science and technology areas.
He received a research grant to study the effect of pollution on the environment.
If you are on a low income, you may be able to get a student grant.
Congress approved block grants for education, health, and social services.
The library received a grant of $20,000 to improve its computer facilities.
We could apply for a grant and start a serious research programme.
This booklet explains who is eligible to receive a grant.
You may be able to get a grant to learn a trade.
It is likely that you will receive a grant to cover your tuition.
If you have been awarded a grant, you must send the details to the university.
The expansion of the computer department was funded by a government grant.
grant.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a sum of money given to a person or organization for a particular purpose, often by a government
grant.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: West Berlin’s Free University was founded with major grants from the Ford Foundation.
The Arts Council awarded (=gave) her  a grant of £2200 for a photographic mission to the Andes.
grant.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to officially give a person or an organization something they have asked for
grant.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The government granted the U.S. company timber rights to a 28,000-square-mile area.
The company has been granted a temporary license to continue mining.
